ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Umbra/RabbitMQ Problem [1 Attachment]
ygData.msgSnippet: Hello Markus, Sorry this slipped my mind until now. I don t see anything wrong with your configuration. Is it possible your rabbitmq is overloaded? I m not

From: Noah Levitt <nlevitt@...>

Hello Markus,

Sorry this slipped my mind until now. I don't see anything w=
rong with
your configuration. Is it possible your rabbitmq is overloaded? I=
'm
not sure what else to look at.

Noah


On Tue, Jul 7, 2015 at 8:57 PM, '=
Markus.Mirsberger'
markus.mirsberger@... [archive-crawler]
<archive-craw=
ler@yahoogroups.com> wrote:
> [Attachment(s) from Markus.Mirsberger include=
d below]
>
> Hi Noah,
>
> I don't even have an own rabbitmq config as it se=
emed to work out of the box
> with the default settings.
> I only activated=
 the rabbitmq management plugin.
>
> I attached the crawler-beans.cxml for =
the specific crawl.
>
>
> Thanks,
> Markus
>
>
> Am 08.07.2015 um 03:40 sch=
rieb Noah Levitt nlevitt@...
> [archive-crawler]:
>
>
> Hello Marku=
s,
>
> Not sure what's going on. I looked at the code where your exception =
is
> coming from, and googled your stack trace, but didn't find anything
> =
particularly helpful. If you want to send your full crawler-beans.cxml I ca=
n
> take a look. There's nothing unusual in your rabbitmq configuration is
=
> there?
>
> Noah
>
>

>> Am 07.07.2015 um 07:24 schrieb Noah Levitt nlevitt@...
>> [ar=
chive-crawler]:
>>
>>
>> Hello Markus,
>>
>> There is something that
>> htt=
ps://sbforge.org/display/NAS/Integrating+Umbra+And+Heritrix+3 neglects to
>=
> mention that might explain the problem you're seeing. AMPQUrlReceiver nee=
ds
>> to be configured with a "queueName" that matches the clientId set on
=
>> AMQPPublishProcessor.
>>
>> Here is an example of the relevant configura=
tion from an archive-it crawl
>> job. Our shouldProcessRule sends only seed=
s to umbra. There are reasons for
>> the particular way it works which I ca=
n explain if anyone is wondering. :)
>> But the important thing to be aware=
 of is that the shouldProcessRule can be
>> used to limit the umbra treatme=
nt to the urls of your choice.
>>
>>         <bean id=3D"amqpUrlReceiver"
>=
> class=3D"org.archive.crawler.frontier.AMQPUrlReceiver">
>>               =
  <property name=3D"queueName"
>> value=3D"archiveit.prod.9876-201507042328=
58960"/>
>>                 <property name=3D"amqpUri"
>> value=3D"amqp://g=
uest:guest@localhost:5672/%2f"/>
>>         </bean>
>>
>>         <bean id=
=3D"amqpPublishProcessor"
>> class=3D"org.archive.modules.AMQPPublishProces=
sor">
>>                 <property name=3D"amqpUri"
>> value=3D"amqp://gues=
t:guest@localhost:5672/%2f"/>
>>                 <property name=3D"clientId=
"
>> value=3D"archiveit.prod.9876-20150704232858960"/>
>>                 <=
property name=3D"shouldProcessRule">
>>                         <bean
>> cl=
ass=3D"org.archive.modules.deciderules.ExpressionDecideRule">
>>           =
                      <property name=3D"decision" value=3D"REJECT"/>
>>    =
                             <property name=3D"groovyExpression"
>> value=
=3D"!(curi.via =3D=3D null && (curi.hasBeenLinkExtracted() ||
>> (c=
uri.getFetchStatus() >=3D 300 && curi.getFetchStatus() <
>> 4=
00)))"/>
>>                         </bean>
>>                 </property>
=
>>         </bean>
>>
>> If the problem persists, please send the full stac=
k trace.
>>
>> Noah
>>
>>
>> On Mon, Jul 6, 2015 at 3:27 AM, 'Markus.Mirsbe=
rger'
>> markus.mirsberger@... [archive-crawler] <archive-crawler@yahoog=
roups.com>
>> wrote:

>>>
>>>

the URLs are beeing sent to
>>> Umbra/RabbitMQ because of the Status sentTo=
AMQP

....I

>>>

e problem is that I can not see anything comming back from

MQ ..... the documentation says that I should see URLs with the
>>> status =
received FromAMQP. This doesnt happen but instead I get this in my
>>> job =
logs:

0 seconds)

ogfile from rabbitmq says this:

>>> closing AMQP connection <0.15717.1733> (127.0.0=
.1:45721 ->
>>> 127.0.0.1:5672)
>>>
>>>
>>> As you can see rabbitmq is acce=
ption 2 connections from heritrix and when
>>> I finish the crawl both are =
closed.

nections

 comming every

mer.
